name: Me, But Online
description: A collection of minimalist, original personal websites with great typography.

name: Svelte French Toast
description: Buttery smooth toast notifications for Svelte. Lightweight, customizable, and beautiful by default. Inspired by React Hot Toast.

name: Lipwig
description: Provides an email address for your Discord or Slack community, which you can use to sign up for newsletters, forward emails from your support team’s inbox, and more.

name: Unslant
description: Browser extension that surfaces contrasting takes on political news as you read. Available for Chrome.

name: Rucksack
description: Open source, self-hosted alternative to Substack and Revue with subscriber analytics, theming, drafts, and a dashboard. Built on Rails and React.

name: Wayfer
description: Wi-Fi based file transfer app. Just drop a file and scan the code.

name: Exun 2018
description: Event app for Exun 2018, the 24th annual festival of my high school technology club. Used to deliver 55,000 notifications to hundreds of devices.

name: Aech
description: A CSS starter kit optimized to provide reasonable defaults so you need minimal styling to get something that looks pretty. Used on this website!

name: koa-auth-basic
description: A Koa middleware for HTTP Basic authentication.

name: Walnut
description: A Brainf*** to Go transpiler with some optimizations, including loops. Based on Rob Pike’s famous talk “Lexical Scanning in Go.”

name: Roller
description: A fast and memory-efficient text truncation utility written in Rust, for use with window managers like i3 and bspwm.

name: Isnochys Syntax
description: “In space, no one can hear you scream.” A high-contrast Atom syntax theme that's easy on the eyes.

name: Fu
description: Unix’s Find, Unleashed. An intuitive alternative to the Unix “find” command.
